meanings.definition: Relating to or constituting a synopsis; presenting a general view or summary.
meanings.sent1: The teacher provided a synoptical overview of the entire course in just one slide.
meanings.sent2: The synoptical report highlighted the key points for easy understanding.
meanings.sent3: The synoptical summary was so concise that it made the students laugh at how much information was packed in.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a synoptical manner, quickly grasping the main ideas from complex texts.
meanings.sent5: The synoptical presentation left a lasting impression on the audience with its clear and concise format.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the synoptic Gospels.
meanings.sent1: The synoptical passages in the Bible offer a unified view of Jesus' teachings.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often study the synoptical Gospels together to compare the accounts.
meanings.sent3: The synoptical nature of the Gospels made it easier for readers to follow Jesus' life.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the synoptical texts deepened after attending the Bible study group.
meanings.sent5: The synoptical approach of the Gospels allowed for a comprehensive understanding of Jesus' ministry.
